original: Majjhima Nikāya 82
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Raṭṭhapālasutta
analyzed: raṭṭhapāla sutta
translated: With Ratthapala

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kurūsu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena thullakoṭṭhikaṁ nāma kurūnaṁ nigamo tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kurūsu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena thullakoṭṭhikam nāma kurūnam nigamaḥ tat avasari
translated: Once the Buddha was traveling through the Kosalan country with a large company of some five hundred monks. He arrived at a Kosalan town called Thullakotthita.

original: Assosuṁ kho thullakoṭṭhikā brāhmaṇagahapatikā:
analyzed: assosum kho thullakoṭṭhikā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā
translated: The brahmins and householders of Thullakotthita heard that:

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito kurūsu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ thullakoṭṭhikaṁ anuppatto.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ kurūsu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim thullakoṭṭhikam anuppattaḥ
translated: “The ascetic Gotama, the Sakyan son who went forth from a Sakyan family, has arrived at Thullakotthita.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:🔽‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ  iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: And this good report about him has spread:🔽‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a blessed one.’

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He has realized this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—and he makes it known.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing; he reveals a holy life that’s utterly perfect and pure.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

original: Atha kho thullakoṭṭhikā brāhmaṇagahapatikā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: atha kho thullakoṭṭhikāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Then the brahmin householders of Thullakotthita went to the Buddha.

original: appekacce bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce bhagavatā saddhiṁ
analyzed: appekacce bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce bhagavatā saddhi
translated: Some bowed down to the Buddha and sat to one side,

original: sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce🔽yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce bhagavato santike
analyzed: sammodisu sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce  yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appa ekacce bhagavato santike
translated: some exchanged greetings with him and, after the greetings and polite conversation were over, sat to one side,🔽some raised their joined palms to the Buddha and sat to one side,🔽some announced their name and clan to the Buddha and sat to one side,

original: nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce tuṇhībhūtā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: nāma gottam sāvetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce tuṇhībhūtāḥ ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: and some sat to one side in silence.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho thullakoṭṭhike brāhmaṇagahapatike bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinne kho thullakoṭṭhike brāhmaṇa gahapatike bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi
translated: As they were sitting there, the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened them with a teaching.

original: Tena kho pana samayena raṭṭhapālo nāma kulaputto tasmiṁyeva thullakoṭṭhike aggakulassa putto tissaṁ parisāyaṁ nisinno hoti.🔽Atha kho raṭṭhapālassa kulaputtassa etadahosi:
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena raṭṭhapālaḥ nāma kula putto tasmiya eva thullakoṭṭhike agga kulassa putto tissam parisāyam nisinnaḥ hoti  atha kho raṭṭhapālassa kula puttassa etat ahosi
translated: Now on that occasion a young man named Ratthapala, the son of a wealthy family in Thullakotthita, was sitting in that assembly.

original: “yathā yathā khvāhaṁ bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: yathā yathā khvā aham bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: Then he thought, “As I understand the Dhamma taught by the Buddha, it’s not easy living at home to live the holy life totally perfect, totally pure, like a polished shell.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Why don’t I shave off my hair & beard, put on the ochre robes, and go forth from the household life into homelessness?”

original: Atha kho thullakoṭṭhikā brāhmaṇagahapatikā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā
analyzed: atha kho thullakoṭṭhikā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā
translated: Then the brahmin householders of Thullakotthita, having been instructed, inspired, and gladdened by the Buddha with a teaching,

original: samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṁsitā bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā
analyzed: samādapitā samuttejitā sampahasitā bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā
translated: and after greatly delighting and rejoicing in the Fortunate One’s words, he rose from his seat,

original: bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkamiṁsu.
analyzed: bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkamisu
translated: and after worshipping and circumambulating the Fortunate One, he went away.

original: Atha kho raṭṭhapālo kulaputto acirapakkantesu thullakoṭṭhikesu brāhmaṇagahapatikesu
analyzed: atha kho raṭṭhapālaḥ kula putto acira pakkantesu thullakoṭṭhikesu brāhmaṇa gahapatikesu
translated: Then not long after the Thullakotthita brahmin householders had gone,

original: yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: the young man Ratthapala approached the Fortunate One, and after approaching and worshipping the Fortunate One, he sat down on one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho raṭṭhapālo kulaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho raṭṭhapālaḥ kula puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: While sitting on one side the young man Ratthapala said this to the Fortunate One:

original: “yathā yathāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: yathā yathā āha bhante bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: “As I understand the Dhamma taught by the Fortunate One it is not easy while living in a home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished shell.

original: Icchāmahaṁ, bhante, kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaha bhante kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitu
translated: I wish, venerable Sir, having cut off my hair and beard, and putting on the yellow robe, to go forth from the home to the homeless life.

original: Labheyyāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: labheyya āha bhante bhagavato santike pabbajja labheyyam upasampada
translated: “Venerable Sir, may I please receive the going forth and full ordination in the presence of the Buddha.”

original: Pabbājetu maṁ bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: pabbājetu mama bhagavā iti
translated: “May the Buddha please give me the going forth.”

original: “Anuññātosi pana tvaṁ, raṭṭhapāla, mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti?
analyzed: anuññātaḥ asi pana tva raṭṭhapāla mātā pitūhi agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “But, Ratthapala, have you been approved by your parents to go forth from the home life into homelessness?”

original: “Na khohaṁ, bhante, anuññāto mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: na kho uha bhante anuññātaḥ mātā pitūhi agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “No, Venerable Sir, I have not.”

original: “Na kho, raṭṭhapāla, tathāgatā ananuññātaṁ mātāpitūhi puttaṁ pabbājentī”ti.
analyzed: na kho raṭṭhapāla tathāgatāḥ an anuññātam mātā pitūhi puttam pabbājenti iti
translated: “Ratthapala, the Buddhas do not give the going forth to anyone who has not been approved by their parents.”

original: “Svāhaṁ, bhante, tathā karissāmi yathā maṁ mātāpitaro anujānissanti agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: svāha bhante tathā karissāmi yathā mama mātā pitaraḥ anujānissanti agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “Venerable Sir, I will do whatever is necessary to get my parents’ approval.”

original: Atha kho raṭṭhapālo kulaputto uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena mātāpitaro tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā mātāpitaro etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho raṭṭhapālaḥ kula putto uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā yena mātā pitaraḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā mātā pitaraḥ etat avoca
translated: Then the young man Ratthapala got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and went to his parents. He said to them,

original: “ammatātā, yathā yathāhaṁ bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: ammatātā yathā yathā aham bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: “Mother, Father, as I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, it’s not easy, living at home, to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

original: Icchāmahaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitu
translated: I wish to cut off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness.

original: Anujānātha maṁ agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: anujānātha mam agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: Please give me your permission to go forth from the lay life to homelessness.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, raṭṭhapālassa kulaputtassa mātāpitaro raṭṭhapālaṁ kulaputtaṁ etadavocuṁ:🔽“tvaṁ khosi, tāta raṭṭhapāla, amhākaṁ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparibhato.
analyzed: evam vutte raṭṭhapālassa kula puttassa mātā pitaraḥ raṭṭhapālam kula puttam etat avocuḥ  tvam kho asi tāta raṭṭhapāla amhākam eka puttakaḥ piyaḥ manāpaḥ sukha edhitaḥ sukha paribhato
translated: When he said this, his parents replied, “Dear Raṭṭhapāla, you are our only son, dear and beloved.

original: Na tvaṁ, tāta raṭṭhapāla, kassaci dukkhassa jānāsi.
analyzed: na tva tāta raṭṭhapāla kassaci dukkhassa jānāsi
translated: You have been raised in comfort, brought up in comfort, and you don’t know suffering.

original: (…) Maraṇenapi te mayaṁ akāmakā vinā bhavissāma.
analyzed: maraṇena api te mayam akāmakāḥ vinā bhavissāma
translated: We would not want to be separated from you even in death,

original: Kiṁ pana mayaṁ taṁ jīvantaṁ anujānissāma agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti?
analyzed: kim pana mayam tam jīvantam anujānissāma agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: so how could we give you permission to go forth from the lay life to homelessness?”

original: Dutiyampi kho raṭṭhapālo kulaputto …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho raṭṭhapālo kula putto pe
translated: A second time …

original: tatiyampi kho raṭṭhapālo kulaputto mātāpitaro etadavoca:
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho raṭṭhapālaḥ kula putto mātā pitaraḥ etat avoca
translated: A third time Rāṭṭhapāla said to his parents,

original: “ammatātā, yathā yathāhaṁ bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: ammatātā yathā yathā aham bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: “Mom, Dad, as I understand the Buddha’s teaching, it’s not easy, while living in a home, to lead the spiritual life utterly perfect and pure as a polished conch shell.

original: Icchāmahaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitu
translated: I wish to shave off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness.

original: Anujānātha maṁ agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: anujānātha mam agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: Please give me your permission to go forth from the lay life to homelessness.”

original: Tatiyampi kho raṭṭhapālassa kulaputtassa mātāpitaro raṭṭhapālaṁ kulaputtaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho raṭṭhapālassa kula puttassa mātā pitaraḥ raṭṭhapālam kula puttam etat avocuḥ
translated: A third time Rāṭṭhapāla’s parents said to him,🔽“Rāṭṭhapāla, you’re our only son, dear and beloved.

original: “tvaṁ khosi, tāta raṭṭhapāla, amhākaṁ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparibhato.
analyzed: tvam kho asi tāta raṭṭhapāla amhākam eka puttakaḥ piyaḥ manāpaḥ sukha edhitaḥ sukha paribhato
translated: You’ve been raised in comfort, brought up in comfort.

original: Na tvaṁ, tāta raṭṭhapāla, kassaci dukkhassa jānāsi.
analyzed: na tva tāta raṭṭhapāla kassaci dukkhassa jānāsi
translated: You don’t know suffering.

original: Maraṇenapi te mayaṁ akāmakā vinā bhavissāma.
analyzed: maraṇena api te mayam akāmakāḥ vinā bhavissāma
translated: We’d rather die than live without you.

original: Kiṁ pana mayaṁ taṁ jīvantaṁ anujānissāma agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti?
analyzed: kim pana mayam tam jīvantam anujānissāma agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: How could we allow you to go forth from the home life into homelessness while you’re still alive?”

original: Atha kho raṭṭhapālo kulaputto:
analyzed: atha kho raṭṭhapālaḥ kula putto
translated: Then the thought occurred to the young man Ratthapala,

original: “na maṁ mātāpitaro anujānanti agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti tattheva anantarahitāya bhūmiyā nipajji:
analyzed: na mam mātā pitaraḥ anujānanti agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati tattha iva anantarahitāya bhūmiyā nipajji
translated: “My mother and father don’t allow me to go forth from the home life into homelessness.” So right there on the spot he lay down on the bare floor, saying,

original: “idheva me maraṇaṁ bhavissati pabbajjā vā”ti.🔽Atha kho raṭṭhapālo kulaputto ekampi bhattaṁ na bhuñji, dvepi bhattāni na bhuñji,
analyzed: idha iva me maraṇam bhavissati pabbajjā vā ati  atha kho raṭṭhapālaḥ kula putto ekam pi bhattam na bhuñji dve pi bhattāni na bhuñji
translated: “Right here I will either die or go forth.”

original: tīṇipi bhattāni na bhuñji, cattāripi bhattāni na bhuñji, pañcapi bhattāni na bhuñji,
analyzed: tīṇi pi bhattāni na bhuñji cattāri pi bhattāni na bhuñji pañca pi bhattāni na bhuñji
translated: Then the young man Ratthapala, not eating in the morning, not eating in the evening, not eating at night, not eating by day, not eating out of the proper time, not licking his lips, not receiving hospitality, not accepting invitations, not taking food on faith, not accepting gold and silver,

original: chapi bhattāni na bhuñji, sattapi bhattāni na bhuñji.
analyzed: chapi bhattāni na bhuñji sattapi bhattāni na bhuñji
translated: went without food, his body emaciated.

original: Atha kho raṭṭhapālassa kulaputtassa mātāpitaro raṭṭhapālaṁ kulaputtaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha kho raṭṭhapālassa kula puttassa mātā pitaraḥ raṭṭhapālam kula puttam etat avocu
translated: Then his mother and father said to him,

original: “tvaṁ khosi, tāta raṭṭhapāla, amhākaṁ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparibhato.
analyzed: tvam kho asi tāta raṭṭhapāla amhākam eka puttakaḥ piyaḥ manāpaḥ sukha edhitaḥ sukha paribhato
translated: “Dear Ratthapala, you are our only son, dear and beloved.

original: Na tvaṁ, tāta raṭṭhapāla, kassaci, dukkhassa jānāsi.
analyzed: na tva tāta raṭṭhapāla kassaci dukkhassa jānāsi
translated: You don’t know anything about suffering.

original: Maraṇenapi te mayaṁ akāmakā vinā bhavissāma.
analyzed: maraṇena api te mayam akāmakāḥ vinā bhavissāma
translated: Even if you were to die, we wouldn’t want to be separated from you.

original: Kiṁ pana mayaṁ taṁ jīvantaṁ anujānissāma agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāya.
analyzed: kim pana mayam tam jīvantam anujānissāma agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya
translated: So how could we allow you to go forth from the lay life to homelessness?

original: Uṭṭhehi, tāta raṭṭhapāla, bhuñja ca piva ca paricārehi ca;
analyzed: uṭṭhehi tāta raṭṭhapāla bhuñja ca piva ca paricārehi ca

translated: Ratthapala got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and set out for Thullakotthita.

original: Anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena thullakoṭṭhiko tadavasari.
analyzed: anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena thullakoṭṭhikaḥ tat avasari

translated: and stayed in the deer park at Thullakotthita.

original: Atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya thullakoṭṭhikaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.

translated: She then went to the mother of Ratthapala and said,

translated: “Please know, lady,

original: Atha kho āyasmato raṭṭhapālassa mātā yenāyasmato raṭṭhapālassa pitā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmato raṭṭhapālassa pitaraṁ etadavoca:

translated: She then went to the father of Ratthapala and said,

original: “yagghe, gahapati, jāneyyāsi:

translated: “Please know, householder,

translated: ‘The young man Ratthapala has arrived?’🔽At that time Venerable Ratthapala was eating the porridge and pumpkin by the root of a wall.

original: Atha kho āyasmato raṭṭhapālassa pitā yenāyasmā raṭṭhapālo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ raṭṭhapālaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ raṭṭhapālassa pitā yena āyasmā raṭṭhapālo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam raṭṭhapālam etat avoca

analyzed: kutas naḥ gahapati amhākam geham agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitāna
translated: “Householder, how can we who have gone forth from the lay life to homelessness go home?

original: Anagārā mayaṁ, gahapati.
analyzed: anagārā gahapati
translated: We’re homeless, householder.

original: Agamamha kho te, gahapati, gehaṁ, tattha neva dānaṁ alatthamha na paccakkhānaṁ;
analyzed: agamamha kho te gahapati geha tattha na iva dānam alatthamha na paccakkhāna

translated: we got only abuse.”🔽“Come, Ratthapala, let’s go home.”

analyzed: tena hi tāta raṭṭhapāla adhivāsehi svātanāya
translated: “Well then, dear Raṭṭhapāla, consent to a meal from me tomorrow.”

translated: The venerable Raṭṭhapāla consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho āyasmato raṭṭhapālassa pitā āyasmato raṭṭhapālassa adhivāsanaṁ viditvā yena🔽sakaṁ nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā mahantaṁ hiraññasuvaṇṇassa puñjaṁ kārāpetvā

translated: Then, knowing that the venerable Raṭṭhapāla had consented by remaining silent, his father🔽had a great heap of gold and silver made,🔽had it covered with a net of gold,

translated: saying: “Come, ladies, adorn yourselves with whatever ornaments you used to adorn yourselves with in the past when you were dear to and beloved by the young man Raṭṭhapāla.”

original: Atha kho āyasmato raṭṭhapālassa pitā tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā āyasmato raṭṭhapālassa kālaṁ ārocesi:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmato raṭṭhapālassa pitā tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena sake nivesane paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā āyasmataḥ raṭṭhapālassa kālam ārocesi
translated: Then, after the night had passed, his father had sumptuous food, both hard and soft, prepared in his own house and had the time announced to the venerable Raṭṭhapāla, saying:

analyzed: kālo tāta raṭṭhapāla niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: “It is time, dear Raṭṭhapāla, the meal is ready.”

translated: Then, when it was morning, Ven. Ratthapala, having put on his robes and carrying his bowl and outer robe, went to his father’s house and, on arrival, sat down on the seat made ready. Then his father, having uncovered a heap of gold and bullion, said to him,

original: “idaṁ te, tāta raṭṭhapāla, mātu mattikaṁ dhanaṁ, aññaṁ pettikaṁ, aññaṁ pitāmahaṁ.
analyzed: idam te tāta raṭṭhapāla mātu mattikam dhana aññam pettika aññam pitāmaha

Then his father, opening the door to the treasure house, said to him, “Son Ratthapala, this is your mother’s treasure. There is another for your father, another for your grandfather.

analyzed: sakkā tāta raṭṭhapāla bhoge ca bhuñjitum puññāni ca kātu

translated: Come, son Ratthapala, turn back to the lower life and enjoy wealth and do meritorious deeds.”

analyzed: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālaḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ bhāsitvā yena raññaḥ korabyassa migacīram tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: Then, while standing, Venerable Raṭṭhapāla recited these verses to the king. He then went to the deer-hide and sat down at the foot of a tree for the day’s meditation.

original: Atha kho rājā korabyo migavaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu rājā korabyaḥ migavam āmantesi
translated: King Koravya then said to the deer-trapper,

original: “sodhehi, samma migava, migacīraṁ uyyānabhūmiṁ;
analyzed: sodhehi samma migava miga cīram uyyāna bhūmi
translated: “Deer-trapper, please prepare the deer-hide in the park.

original: gacchāma subhūmiṁ dassanāyā”ti.
analyzed: gacchāma su bhūmim dassanāya ati
translated: We’re going to the park to see Subhūti.”

original: “Evaṁ, devā”ti kho migavo rañño korabyassa paṭissutvā migacīraṁ sodhento addasa āyasmantaṁ raṭṭhapālaṁ aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisinnaṁ.
analyzed: eva deva ati kho migavaḥ raññaḥ korabyassa paṭissutvā miga cīram sodhentaḥ addase āyasmantam raṭṭhapālam aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisinna
translated: “Yes, sir.” The deer-trapper prepared the deer-hide and then saw Raṭṭhapāla sitting at the foot of a tree for the day’s meditation.

original: Disvāna yena rājā korabyo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rājānaṁ korabyaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvāna yena rājā korabyo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā rājānam korabyam etat avoca
translated: He then went to King Koravya and said,

original: “suddhaṁ kho te, deva, migacīraṁ.
analyzed: suddham khalu te deva migacīra
translated: “Your deer-hide is ready, sir.

original: Atthi cettha raṭṭhapālo nāma kulaputto imasmiṁyeva thullakoṭṭhike aggakulassa putto yassa tvaṁ abhiṇhaṁ kittayamāno ahosi, so aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisinno”ti.
analyzed: atthi ca ittha raṭṭhapālaḥ nāma kula putto imasmiya eva thullakoṭṭhike agga kulassa putto yassa tvam abhiṇham kittayamānaḥ ahosi so aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisinnaḥ ti
translated: There is a young man called Ratthapala, the son of a good family in this very Thullakotthita, who is constantly praised by you. He is sitting at the root of a certain tree on this very day.”

original: “Tena hi, samma migava, alaṁ dānajja uyyānabhūmiyā.
analyzed: tena hi migava alam uyyāna bhūmiyā
translated: “Well then, my dear Migara, that will do for today with the park.

original: Tameva dāni mayaṁ bhavantaṁ raṭṭhapālaṁ payirupāsissāmā”ti.
analyzed: tam eva dāni mayam bhavantam raṭṭhapālam payirupāsissāma ati
translated: Let us go to the venerable Ratthapala.”

original: Atha kho rājā korabyo “yaṁ tattha khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyattaṁ taṁ sabbaṁ vissajjethā”ti🔽vatvā bhadrāni bhadrāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhadraṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhadrehi bhadrehi
analyzed: atha kho rājā korabyaḥ yam tattha khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyattam tam sabbam vissajjetha ati  vatvā bhadrāni bhadrāni yānāni yoja a petvā bhadram yānam abhiruhitvā bhadrehi bhadrehi
translated: Then King Koravya said: “Let whatever food there is prepared be given away.

original: yānehi thullakoṭṭhikamhā niyyāsi mahaccarājānubhāvena āyasmantaṁ raṭṭhapālaṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: yānehi thullakoṭṭhikamhā niyyāsi mahacca rāja anubhāvena āyasmantam raṭṭhapālam dassanāya
translated: ” And having had the best carriages harnessed, he mounted one of them and drove in state from Thullakotthita to see the venerable Ratthapala.

original: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikova ussaṭāya ussaṭāya
analyzed: yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikā uva ussaṭāya ussaṭāya
translated: He drove as far as the ground would allow, then alighted and continued on foot.

original: parisāya yenāyasmā raṭṭhapālo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā raṭṭhapālena
analyzed: parisāya yena āyasmā raṭṭhapālo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā raṭṭhapālena
translated: He approached Venerable Ratthapala🔽and exchanged greetings with him.

original: saddhiṁ sammodi. Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: saddhim sammodi sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamanta
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he stood at one side

original: ṭhito kho rājā korabyo āyasmantaṁ raṭṭhapālaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ kho rājā korabyaḥ āyasmantam raṭṭhapālam etat avoca
translated: and said to him:

original: “idha bhavaṁ raṭṭhapālo hatthatthare nisīdatū”ti.
analyzed: bhavam raṭṭhapālaḥ hatthatthare nisīdatu uti
translated: “Please sit down, sir, on the prepared seat.”

original: “Alaṁ, mahārāja, nisīda tvaṁ;
analyzed: ala mahā rāja nisīda tva
translated: “There’s no need, Great King. You sit down.

original: nisinno ahaṁ sake āsane”ti.
analyzed: nisinnaḥ aham sake āsane iti
translated: I’ll sit on my own seat.”🔽King Koravya sat down on the prepared seat,

original: Nisīdi rājā korabyo paññatte āsane. Nisajja kho rājā korabyo āyasmantaṁ raṭṭhapālaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: nisīdi rājā korabyo paññatte āsane nisajja kho rājā korabyaḥ āyasmantam raṭṭhapālam etat avoca
translated: and he said to Ratthapala:

original: “Cattārimāni, bho raṭṭhapāla, pārijuññāni yehi pārijuññehi samannāgatā idhekacce kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti.
analyzed: cattārimāni bho raṭṭhapāla pārijuññāni yehi pārijuññehi samannāgatāḥ idha ekacce kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajanti
translated: “Sir, there are four kinds of misfortune that can befall a person.

original: Katamāni cattāri?
analyzed: katamāni cattāri
translated: What are they?

original: Jarāpārijuññaṁ, byādhipārijuññaṁ, bhogapārijuññaṁ, ñātipārijuññaṁ.
analyzed: jarā pārijuñña byādhi pārijuñña bhoga pārijuñña ñāti pārijuñña
translated: Old age, sickness, loss of wealth, and death.

original: Katamañca, bho raṭṭhapāla, jarāpārijuññaṁ?
analyzed: katamat ca bho raṭṭhapāla jarā pārijuñña
translated: “And what, sir, is the misery of old age?

original: Idha, bho raṭṭhapāla, ekacco jiṇṇo hoti vuḍḍho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto.
analyzed: idha bho raṭṭhapāla ekaccaḥ jiṇṇaḥ hoti vuḍḍhaḥ mahallakaḥ addha gataḥ vayaḥ anuppatto
translated: Here, sir, someone becomes old, decrepit, feeble, and aged.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He reflects:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi etarahi jiṇṇo vuḍḍho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto.
analyzed: aham kho amhi etarahi jiṇṇaḥ vuḍḍhaḥ mahallakaḥ addha gataḥ vayaḥ anuppatto
translated: ‘I am now old, decrepit, feeble, and aged.

original: Na kho pana mayā sukaraṁ anadhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ adhigantuṁ adhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ phātiṁ kātuṁ.
analyzed: na khalu pana mayā sukaram an adhigatam vā bhogam adhigantum adhigatam vā bhogam phātim kātu
translated: It is not easy for me to acquire fresh wealth or to augment the wealth I have already acquired.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Why don’t I shave off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and go forth from the home life into homelessness?’

original: So tena jarāpārijuññena samannāgato kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: so tena jarā pārijuññena samannāgataḥ kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: So, because of the misery of old age, he shaves off his hair and beard, puts on the yellow robe, and goes forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Idaṁ vuccati, bho raṭṭhapāla, jarāpārijuññaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bho raṭṭhapāla jarā pārijuñña
translated: This is called the misery of old age.

original: Bhavaṁ kho pana raṭṭhapālo etarahi daharo yuvā susukāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā.
analyzed: bhavam kho pana raṭṭhapālaḥ etarahi daharaḥ yuvā susu kāḷa kesaḥ bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā
translated: But you, sir, are now young, a youth, black-haired, endowed with the blessing of youth, in the first stage of life.

original: Taṁ bhoto raṭṭhapālassa jarāpārijuññaṁ natthi.
analyzed: tam bhoto raṭṭhapālassa jarā pārijuññam natthi
translated: But you, sir, have no such aging and death.

original: Kiṁ bhavaṁ raṭṭhapālo ñatvā vā disvā vā sutvā vā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito?
analyzed: kim bhavam raṭṭhapālaḥ ñatvā vā disvā vā sutvā vā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ
translated: What have you seen and known to go forth from the home life into homelessness?”

original: Katamañca, bho raṭṭhapāla, byādhipārijuññaṁ?
analyzed: katamat ca bho raṭṭhapāla byādhi pārijuñña
translated: “And what, sir, is the danger of sickness?

original: Idha, bho raṭṭhapāla, ekacco ābādhiko hoti dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
analyzed: idha bho raṭṭhapāla ekaccaḥ ābādhikaḥ hoti dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ
translated: Here, sir, someone is afflicted, suffering, and gravely ill.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He considers:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi etarahi ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
analyzed: aham kho amhi etarahi ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ
translated: ‘I am now afflicted, suffering, and gravely ill.

original: Na kho pana mayā sukaraṁ anadhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ adhigantuṁ adhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ phātiṁ kātuṁ.
analyzed: na khalu pana mayā sukaram an adhigatam vā bhogam adhigantum adhigatam vā bhogam phātim kātu
translated: It is not easy for me, afflicted as I am, to acquire unacquired goods or to augment goods already acquired.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Why don’t I shave off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and go forth from the home life into homelessness?’

original: So tena byādhipārijuññena samannāgato kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: so tena byādhi pārijuññena samannāgataḥ kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: So, because of the danger of sickness, he shaves off his hair and beard, puts on the yellow robe, and goes forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Idaṁ vuccati, bho raṭṭhapāla, byādhipārijuññaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bho raṭṭhapāla byādhi pārijuñña
translated: This is called the danger of sickness.

original: Bhavaṁ kho pana raṭṭhapālo etarahi appābādho appātaṅko samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgato nātisītāya nāccuṇhāya.
analyzed: bhavam kho pana raṭṭhapālo etarahi appa ābādhaḥ appa ātaṅko sama vepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgataḥ na ati sītāya na accuṇhāya
translated: But Bhava Ratthapala is now free from illness and affliction. He is easy to support and not difficult to support, he is easy to look after and not difficult to look after, he is strong and robust and capable of enduring the discomfort of the rains.

original: Taṁ bhoto raṭṭhapālassa byādhipārijuññaṁ natthi.
analyzed: tam bhoto raṭṭhapālassa byādhi pārijuññam natthi
translated: So there is no danger of his dying.

original: Kiṁ bhavaṁ raṭṭhapālo ñatvā vā disvā vā sutvā vā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito?
analyzed: kim bhavam raṭṭhapālaḥ ñatvā vā disvā vā sutvā vā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ
translated: What has Bhava Ratthapala known or seen or heard that he has gone forth from the home life into homelessness?

original: Katamañca, bho raṭṭhapāla, bhogapārijuññaṁ?
analyzed: kataman ca bho raṭṭhapāla bhoga pārijuñña
translated: “And what, Ratthapala, is the danger in wealth?

original: Idha, bho raṭṭhapāla, ekacco aḍḍho hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo.
analyzed: idha bho raṭṭhapālaḥ ekaccaḥ aḍḍhaḥ hoti mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogo
translated: Here, Ratthapala, someone is wealthy, with great riches and great possessions.

original: Tassa te bhogā anupubbena parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: tassa te bhogāḥ anupubbena parikkhayam gacchanti
translated: But his wealth gradually diminishes.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He reflects:

original: ‘ahaṁ kho pubbe aḍḍho ahosiṁ mahaddhano mahābhogo.
analyzed: aham kho pubbe aḍḍhaḥ ahosim mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ
translated: ‘Formerly I was wealthy, with great riches and great possessions.

original: Tassa me te bhogā anupubbena parikkhayaṁ gatā.
analyzed: tassa me te bhogāḥ anupubbena parikkhayam gatā
translated: But now my wealth has gradually diminished.

original: Na kho pana mayā sukaraṁ anadhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ adhigantuṁ adhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ phātiṁ kātuṁ.
analyzed: na khalu pana mayā sukaram an adhigatam vā bhogam adhigantum adhigatam vā bhogam phātim kātu
translated: It is not easy for me to acquire wealth anew, nor is it easy for me to make my former wealth go round.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Why don’t I shave off my hair & beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth from the home life into homelessness?’

original: So tena bhogapārijuññena samannāgato kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: so tena bhoga pārijuññena samannāgataḥ kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: So, with that loss of wealth, he shaves off his hair & beard, puts on the ocher robes, and goes forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Idaṁ vuccati, bho raṭṭhapāla, bhogapārijuññaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bho raṭṭhapāla bhoga pārijuñña
translated: This is called loss of wealth.

original: Bhavaṁ kho pana raṭṭhapālo imasmiṁyeva thullakoṭṭhike aggakulassa putto.
analyzed: bhavam kho pana raṭṭhapālaḥ imasmiya eva thullakoṭṭhike agga kulassa putto
translated: “Now, Master Ratthapala, you are the son of a leading clan in this very Thullakotthita.

original: Taṁ bhoto raṭṭhapālassa bhogapārijuññaṁ natthi.
analyzed: tam bhoto raṭṭhapālassa bhoga pārijuññam natthi
translated: You have no loss of wealth.

original: Kiṁ bhavaṁ raṭṭhapālo ñatvā vā disvā vā sutvā vā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito?
analyzed: kim bhavam raṭṭhapālaḥ ñatvā vā disvā vā sutvā vā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ
translated: Having known what, having seen what, having heard what, did you go forth from the home life into homelessness?

original: Katamañca, bho raṭṭhapāla, ñātipārijuññaṁ?
analyzed: katamat ca bho raṭṭhapāla ñāti pārijuñña
translated: “And what, Master Ratthapala, is loss of relatives?

original: Idha, bho raṭṭhapāla, ekaccassa bahū honti mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā.
analyzed: idha bho raṭṭhapāla ekaccassa bahū honti mitta amaccāḥ ñāti sālohitā
translated: “There is the case where one has many friends, companions, & relatives.

original: Tassa te ñātakā anupubbena parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: tassa te ñātakāḥ anupubbena parikkhayam gacchanti
translated: Then, over a period of time, those friends, companions, & relatives gradually die off.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He reflects thus:

original: ‘mamaṁ kho pubbe bahū ahesuṁ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā.
analyzed: mamam kho pubbe bahū ahesum mitta amaccāḥ ñāti sālohitā
translated: ‘Formerly I had many friends, companions, & relatives.

original: Tassa me te anupubbena parikkhayaṁ gatā.
analyzed: tassa me te anupubbena parikkhayam gatā
translated: They gradually disappeared.

original: Na kho pana mayā sukaraṁ anadhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ adhigantuṁ adhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ phātiṁ kātuṁ.
analyzed: na khalu pana mayā sukaram an adhigatam vā bhogam adhigantum adhigatam vā bhogam phātim kātu
translated: It is not easy for me to acquire wealth that has not been acquired, or to increase wealth that has been acquired.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Why don’t I shave off my hair & beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth from the home life into homelessness?”

original: So tena ñātipārijuññena samannāgato kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: so tena ñāti pārijuññena samannāgataḥ kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: So, afflicted by the loss of relatives, he shaves off his hair & beard, puts on the ocher robes, and goes forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Idaṁ vuccati, bho raṭṭhapāla, ñātipārijuññaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati bho raṭṭhapāla ñāti pārijuñña
translated: This is called loss of relatives.

original: Bhoto kho pana raṭṭhapālassa imasmiṁyeva thullakoṭṭhike bahū mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā.
analyzed: bhoto kho pana raṭṭhapālassa imasmiya eva thullakoṭṭhike bahū mitta amaccāḥ ñāti sālohitā
translated: But Master Ratthapala has many friends, many colleagues, and many relatives here in Thullakotthita.

original: Taṁ bhoto raṭṭhapālassa ñātipārijuññaṁ natthi.
analyzed: tat bhoto raṭṭhapālassa ñāti pārijuññam natthi
translated: So this loss of relatives doesn’t apply to Master Ratthapala.

original: Kiṁ bhavaṁ raṭṭhapālo ñatvā vā disvā vā sutvā vā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito?
analyzed: kim bhavam raṭṭhapālaḥ ñatvā vā disvā vā sutvā vā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ
translated: Having known what, having seen what, having heard what, has Master Ratthapala gone forth from the home life into homelessness?
